definition: Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
surname Zhu
vermilion
bright/warm

sentences.english: Family Ritual was the Zhuxi's most influential book.
sentences.chinese: 《家禮》是南宋朱熹最有影響的禮學著作。

sentences.english: Confucian philosopher Zhuxi started the Confucian Thought.
sentences.chinese: 理學大師朱熹開創了理學思想的先茅。

sentences.english: Among Zhu Xi's disciples, Chen Chun is considered to be one who had more inventions and original idea.
sentences.chinese: 在朱熹門人中，陳淳被認爲是多有發明和創見的一位。

sentences.english: All articles spring from Tao" is Zhuxi s famous proposition on writing."
sentences.chinese: “文皆是從道中流出”是朱熹的著名文論命題。

sentences.english: The third part introduces the application of Zhu Xi's view in the social and historical field mainly.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分主要介紹朱熹理欲觀在社會歷史領域的運用。

sentences.english: Chu Hsi's moral educational thought is established on his theory in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 朱熹的道德教育思想是以他的哲學理論爲基礎的。

sentences.english: In chapter six, Zhu Xi's school has conquered Wen Zhou finally.
sentences.chinese: 在第六章，朱熹的朱子學派最終征服了溫州。

sentences.english: Chen Chun, who was a good apprentice of Zhu Xi.
sentences.chinese: 陳淳是理學家朱熹的高徒。

definition: Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Cheng Yi (1033-1107), Song neo-Confucian scholar
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Cheng Hao (1032-1085), Song neo-Confucian scholar
Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073), Song dynasty neo-Confucian scholar
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Confucianism
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Shao Yong (1011-1077), Northern Song poet and Rationalist scholar 理學家|理学家
